priorVersion.title: CDISC Clinical Classification Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Response Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C193263

self.title: CDISC Clinical Classification Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Response Terminology

definition: Tanner Scale Boy original result for TANN0202 test and test code.
name: Tanner Scale Boy Clinical Classification ORRES for TANN0202 TN/TC
preferredTerm: CDISC Clinical Classification Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Response Terminology
synonyms: Tanner Scale Boy Clinical Classification ORRES for TANN0202 TN/TC

terms.definition: Tanner Scale Boy original result for TANN0202-Stage 1: Pre-adolescent. The velus over the pubes is no further developed than that over the abdominal wall, i.e. no pubic hair.
terms.preferredTerm: Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Result - Stage 1

terms.definition: Tanner Scale Boy original result for TANN0202-Stage 2: Sparse growth of long, slightly pigmented, downy hair, straight or only slightly curled, appearing chiefly at the base of the penis. This stage is difficult to see on photographs, particularly of fair-haired subjects. Although the rating 'Stage 2' was used in this study, it cannot be regarded as reliable, and the ages at which subjects are said to have reached Stage 2 are almost certainly too late.
terms.preferredTerm: Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Result - Stage 2

terms.definition: Tanner Scale Boy original result for TANN0202-Stage 3: Considerably darker, coarser, and more curled. The hair spreads sparsely over the junction of the pubes. This and subsequent stages were clearly recognizable on the photographs.
terms.preferredTerm: Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Result - Stage 3

terms.definition: Tanner Scale Boy original result for TANN0202-Stage 4: Hair is now adult in type, but the area covered by it is still considerably smaller than in most adults. There is no spread to the medial surface of the thighs.
terms.preferredTerm: Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Result - Stage 4

terms.definition: Tanner Scale Boy original result for TANN0202-Stage 5: Adult in quantity and type, distributed as an inverse triangle of the classically feminine pattern. Spread to the medial surface of the thighs but not up the linea alba or elsewhere above the base of the inverse triangle.
terms.preferredTerm: Tanner Scale Boy TANN0202 Original Result - Stage 5
